entry.title: Communication between Java Enterprise Applications
entry.content:
Recently I came across the following problem : How to propagate information from one enterprise application to another in a transparent manner. Transparent meaning without changing the API. The typical use case is to propagate information such as the language or applicative security information (not the JAAS role). Moreover, I would like the information to be "request scoped" and to be automatically cleaned up.

Let me add that I currently work with JEE6 on WebSphere 8.5.5.

I did some research among blogs and forums and I found the following solutions:

1) Passing information in thread-local

2) Using the JNDI

3) TransactionSynchronizationRegistry

4) Work Area Service

[1] Adam Bien. HOW TO PASS CONTEXT IN STANDARD WAY - WITHOUT THREADLOCAL. http://www.adam-bien.com/roller/abien/entry/how_to_pass_context_in [2] Adam Bien.
